commits.message: Back to development: 4.2.2
Preparing release 4.2.1
Make sure that manifest gets included.
Updated Travis YAML.
'Updated Travis YAML.'
Updated version to what it will be on this branch.
vb
Get ready for release.
Create a working release.
Fixed docstrings and whitespaces.

Merging Tarek's and Andreas' work on making the HTTP sub-protocols 
pluggable. This will make Jim Washington, who wrote the JSON server, 
really happy. :-)

Reviewed Tarek's and Andreas' work on the puggable HTTP-subprotocol work. 
I like the final solution, especially having taken part in the design 
discussions. While a priority-driven system might seem sub-optimal, it is 
much saner than the alternative, which is to have huge complexity for a 
task that needs to perform well.

In the code below I fixed some code to more common Zope 3 patterns.

- Formalized the Publisher Response API.

  + Until now the publisher made assumptions about the form of ouput of
    a publishing process. Either the called method returned a string
    (regular or unicode) or the response's write() method was used
    directly to write the data. Those models do not work well with some
    protocols. Thus, now the publisher deals with result objects. Those
    are generally not well defined, but for HTTP they must implement the
    IResult interface.

  + HTTP responses provide two new methods that make reading the output
    easier: `consumeBody()` and `consumeBodyIter()`. Either method can
    be only called once. After that the output iterator is used and
    empty.

  + The WSGI specification specifically has some provisions in it that
    supported our use of writing directly to the output stream. However,
    this method of providing an output is strongly discouraged. Instead,
    the application should return an iterable. Using the new IResult
    implementation in the HTTP publisher, we can now return such an
    iterable.

  + When a retry is issued in the publisher, then a new request is
    created. This means that the request (including its response) that
    were passed into `publish()` are not necessarily the same that are
    eventually used. This caused some failures in the WSGI support. Now
    the `publish()` method returns the used request and the request's
    `close()` method does not unlink the response, so that
    `request.response` is still available after the publish call.


There are several oppurtunities here:

1. Support large file uploads and downloads without using up a lot of 
   memory.

2. Use the concept of results for protocols that do not fit the simple 
   body response scheme.

...
Some test cleanups.
Fixed little buglet.

- Removal of Services. You can now access the adapter and utiliy
  registry directly via the site manager's `adapters` and `utilities`
  attribute, respecitvely.

  + Converted Principal Annotation Service to be a utility. Added
    database evolution code to convert all service instances to
    utilities.
  
  + Converted FSSync Service to be a utility.

  + Created the concept of a global site manager. The adapter and
    utility registry, formerly the adapter and utility service, are now
    managed by the site manager.

  + The `zope.app.utility` package has been merged into
    `zope.app.component`. The utility registration class is in
    `site.py`. The utility vocabulary is in `vocabulary.py`.

  + The `zope.app.site` package has been merged into
    `zope.app.component`. The site code can be found in `site.py`.

  + Fixed persistent modules code. Persistent modules are now simply
    utilities providing `IModuleManager`. The local site manager also
    does not know any thing about persistent modules anymore.

  + Updated `zope.app.pluggableauth`, so that it will work as an
    authentication utility.

  + Restructured `zope.app.persentation` (a.k.a page folders) to the new
    component API.

- Simplified the registration framework by only supporting two states:
  active and inactive. This allowed us to get rid of the registration
  stack and the complexity it introduced to the site management.

- Removed all presentation-related APIs from `zope.component`. This
  included the removal of presentation-related interfaces and the
  deprecation of all view-related API functions. One should use the
  adapter API functions instead.

- Implemented some initial deprecation framework, see
  `zope.deprecation`. It allows one to deprecate methods and properties
  in classes as well as any name in a module.

- Moved reusable test setups/APIs from `zope.app.tests` to
  `zope.app.testing`. No reusable testing code should be in a `tests`
  package or module.

Converted Authentication Service to be a utility. Renamed PAS to
PAU.
Restructured the error reporting service to become a utility.

The presentation service is gone.

The default skin is now set in the `beforeTraversal()` hook of Zope
Publication.

The presentation service is gone.

Use adapter service and ztapi instead.
Fix ReST error
Back to development: 4.2.1
Preparing release 4.2.0

Drop Python 3.3 support

The only reason for this is that Travis build fails on 3.3 for totally
unclear reasons.

I don't know any LTS distributions still on Python 3.3.  Ubuntu 12.04
has Python 3.2.  Ubuntu 14.04 has Python 3.4.  Debian 8 (Jessie) has
Python 3.4.

Merge pull request #7 from zopefoundation/fix_transaction_2

Fix compatibility with transaction >= 2.0 and ZODB >= 5.1.

Remove redundant --source=...

It's already specified in .coveragerc

Merge pull request #4 from zopefoundation/remove-nondeterminism

Expect headers to be sorted

Expect headers to be sorted

Fixes #3, assuming that
https://github.com/zopefoundation/zope.publisher/pull/9 gets merged.
Use the faster Travis container-based infrastructure

Update to latest bootstrap.py

Downloaded from https://bootstrap.pypa.io/bootstrap-buildout.py

Stop supporting zope.app.wsgi < 3.11

This breaks with setuptools >= 8.0, since multiple constraints are
logically ANDed now, as per PEP 440, and this results in an inherent
contradiction.

The contraint was originally introduced in
8f8c3bbf3f96271673f8566875cc8965d23202f5 with no explanation of why 3.11
was a bad zope.app.wsgi version to use.

Update to latest bootstrap.py

Downloaded from http://downloads.buildout.org/2/bootstrap.py
Include tox.ini in the manifest
Ignore .tox

Merge pull request #1 from minddistrict/master

Improve the publication factory lookup by falling back to a more generic
registration if the specific factory chooses not to handle the request
after all.

Also, fail clearly by raising an configuration error always if no
handling factory can be (instead of returning None in that case, which
is not handled properly in the callee).
Oops, don't run the same tests twice

Remove Python 3 from .travis.yml, use tox to run tests

Python 3 support was added in the py3 branch which remains unmerged.
PEP-8-ify setup.py, add PyPI classifiers

Pin zope.app.wsgi to <4.0dev in tox.ini too

See commit 3561efd35bf3b5a9a2b5666a7711337f32c09f01

Make version pins works with zc.buildout 1.7

I've no idea why winbot gets zc.buildout 1.7 despite me having placed
the latest 2.0 bootstrap.py right here.
Pin zope.app.wsgi to <4.0dev to avoid test failures

Update to latest bootstrap

Downloaded from http://downloads.buildout.org/2/bootstrap.py

Introduce ZopePublication.callErrorView as a possible hook point.

I've a project where I override ZopePublication.callObject and log the view
class and source location.  Combined with Dozer logview middleware this makes
it trivial to find the source code responsible for rendering a particular page
-- unless that page was rendered by an error view, which doesn't go though
callObject.  Hence this patch.

Fix the test failure caught by buildbot.  Garbage-collector related race
conditions are fun to debug.

Fixed issue 497: HTTP DELETE now returns 405 Method Not Allowed when the
container cannot be adapted to IWriteDirectory.

issue_comments.body:
Okay, I figured out why tests fail with tox: tox.ini was missing a version pin (`zope.app.wsgi < 4.0.dev`) that was present in buildout.cfg.

I've fixed that.
BTW Travis CI doesn't notice or test pull requests because https://github.com/zopefoundation/zope.githubsupport/issues/1
Oh, before I merge: would you mind adding a CHANGES.txt entry?

Actually, there's another blocker: tests fail on Python 2.6:

```
Error in test test_fail_if_no_factory_can_be_found (zope.app.publication.tests.test_requestpublicationregistry.Test)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/unittest.py", line 279, in run
    testMethod()
  File "/home/mg/src/new-zope-order/zope.app.publication/.tox/py26/lib/python2.6/site-packages/zope/app/publication/tests/test_requestpublicationregistry.py", line 177, in test_fail_if_no_factory_can_be_found
    with self.assertRaises(ConfigurationError):
TypeError: failUnlessRaises() takes at least 3 arguments (2 given)
```

You need to add `unittest2` to setup.py and `import unittest2 as unittest` if you want to use the context-manager form of `assertRaises`.
Merged, thanks!
AFAICS zope.app.wsgi.testlayer.http() has a non-deterministic output ordering.  Probably relies on dictionary internal sort ordering or something.

Actually it's zope.publisher that [serializes response headers in semi-random order](https://github.com/zopefoundation/zope.publisher/blob/57a3cee97207ab4a4f05924a07857d007109e17c/src/zope/publisher/http.py#L724).
This needs to be rebased on master, so we get a working Travis build.
Eagerly waiting for a new release to see if it'll fix zodbbrowser's failures!

Travis failures are from `python setup.py ftest` failing on Python 3 somewhere deep in the internals of setuptools.  I cannot reproduce that failure by running `tox` on my laptop.

Modest proposal: change tox.ini to run zope-testrunner directly.  That's what, e.g., [ZODB's tox.ini](https://github.com/zopefoundation/ZODB/blob/master/tox.ini#L7-L17) does.

When I said I couldn't reproduce that failure by running `tox` on my laptop, I meant:

- I tried git master and tox ran tests for all Python versions and produced failures because of changes to ZODB
- I tried the `fix_transaction_2` branch and tox ran tests for all Python versions, but tests for all Python 3.x versions failed with a strange `ImportError: No module named 'zope.app.wsgi'` while trying to import `src/zope/app/publication/tests/test_functional.py`.
Let's drop Python 3.3 support.

~~(FWIW that looks like a bug in the `coverage` package to me, but I'm not interested in pursuing it at this time.)~~

EDIT: no, it looks like `python3.3 -c 'import zope; print(zope.__path__)'` would print a string rather than a list with one string in it, which is very strange.

`tox` works for me (including on Python 3.3) on my laptop as well.  It's strange.

Travis has Python 3.3.5, I have Python 3.3.6, but the [changelog](https://hg.python.org/cpython/raw-file/v3.3.6/Misc/NEWS) doesn't show anything that looks relevant.
I'm tempted to merge this now and figure out what to do with Python 3.3 later.  Dropping support for it seems like the least-painful option.

review_comments.body:
Huh?  You're not adding any webtest imports in your patch.  Why this addition?

Setup.py doesn't depend on webtest either.

Can you undo the nonfunctional tox.ini change and update this PR?  I reenabled the Travis CI hook and would like to see if it'll notice and try to run tests for it.

I'll try to figure out what's happening with z.a.publication's tests when I can find the time (it's more fun than $DAYJOB, but pays less).
`--source=zope.app.publication` should not be required, since we specify `source = zope.app.publication` in `./coveragerc`.

issue_comments.body: @mgedmin The `ImportError: No module named 'zope.app.wsgi'` we saw too on the computer of @sallner which is running on Linux. It does not happen on my computer (Mac OS). The problem seem to be the following: when importing `zope.app` it points to `.../src/zope/app` instead of pointing to `.../.tox/pyX/lib/pythonX/sitepackages/zope/app`. The latter one is the case on my computer. We used the same versions of Python, pip and tox.
@mgedmin Doing tox.ini like ZODB helped for Python 3.4 and 3.5 but 3.3 is still failing.

review_comments.body: This leaves only Python 3.3 failing on travis which does not happen locally (Mac OS)

pull_requests.title: backported fix for improved publication factory lookup
pull_requests.body:
Backported the improvement that was handled in https://github.com/zopefoundation/zope.app.publication/pull/1

Original description:

"""
Improve the publication factory lookup by falling back to a more generic registration if the specific factory chooses not to handle the request after all. Also, fail clearly by raising an configuration error //always// if no handling factory can be (instead of returning None in that case, which is not handled properly in the callee).
"""

If the pull request is accepted, I can release a 3.15.0.

issue_comments.body: Ok, thanks for that fix mgedmin!

Updated to work on python 2.6 as well, including the version pin.
I hope everything is in a mergeable-state now.

Thanks again.

review_comments.body: Because I was trying to get the tox-based tests to run, as they do not run for me because webtest cannot be imported. I didn't work though and I forgot to remove that line. Like I said in my comment: something funky is going on regarding running the tests from tox for me.
I've removed the line. Thanks in advance for your help.

Removed insane untested support for non-existent zope 3 versions. :/
Don't include useless traceback in conflict warnings.

These tests aare a little odd because they use DemoStorage and use
it's undoInfo even though DemoStorage doesn't support undo.  If a
storage doesn't support undo, databases no-longer expose the storage's
undo methods.  We could work aroud this by not using a demo storage or
by calling the storage method directly.  Note also that all but one of
these tests could use lastTransaction rather than undoInfo.

Merge of jim-adapter branch:

This branch has three major refactorings on it:

- A redesign of the adapter registration machinery

- A major simplification of local component management

  See zope.component.interfaces.IComponentRegistry.

- A flexible system for combining component registries.

- A beginning of the migration of packages out of zope.app.

- A new package for doing deferred imports.  This allows you
  to make names available at the package level without creating
  circular imports.  See zope.deferredimport and see
  zope.component.__init__ for examples of it's use.  This package
  also provides a way to deprecate names in a module.

- Deprecation of zope. i18nmessageid.MessageID

I should have created checkin messages for individual sets of related
changes, but there were just too many for the time allowed.

Merged from 3.2 branch:

------------------------------------------------------------------------
  r41003 | jim | 2005-12-23 16:01:18 -0500 (Fri, 23 Dec 2005) | 3 lines

Fixed tests that weren't calling request constructors properly.
  The first positional argument is the input stream.

Changed to use ZODB 3.5a2, which has a number of fixes to the
cross-database reference support.

Updated the cleanup object to be an IHeld so it can call the
connection close method to it immediately when a request is closed.
This makes it easier to debug cases where the connection close method
fails, which is usually when it is closed while there are pending
changes.

Moved the marker interface for content to be published as pages to a
sane location.  Also changed zpt pages to use the marker interface.
The point of this is to allow content like this to properly compute
their base href for any links they display.
Changed before-traversal events to be object events.

Created a new interface, IAuthentication, which is the
IAuthenticationUtility/IAuthenticationService interface sans
getPrincipals.  The IAuthenticationUtility/IAuthenticationService and
the getPrincipals method are now deprecated.  We now use IAuthentication.

Added a getPrincipals to the pluggable auth utility with a deprecation
warning.

Improved system error handling

Added a tiny framework to allow the publication object to detect
system errors.  Renamed the default (system error) view to
systemerror.pt and updated it to let the publication know that it
handles system errors.  Updated the publication to log system errors.

The end result of this (and the previous revision) is that, by
default, we *only* log system errors and publication failures to the
site error log, so that these errors get the attention they deserve
without being hidden by user errors.

Change the way traveral and not-found errors are displayed.
Now, the NotFound view is *only* used for NotFound errors,
spcifically, when the URL is bad.  Traversal errors elsewhere lead to
system errors.

Changed the specification for publishTraverse to raise NotFound

Previously, the interface was silent (lazy) on what happened when an
object could not be traversed.

Updated various bits of code to reflect this.

Merged from ZopeX3-3.0 branch:

  r27290 | jim | 2004-08-27 10:28:21 -0400 (Fri, 27 Aug 2004) | 12 lines

Refactored xmlrpc:

- Made it possible to define xml-rpc methods on content. This made the
  "default view" mechanism unnecessary.

- Removed the default-view mechanism.  This is backward incompatable, 
  but it's better to do this now, rather than after X3.0.

This allowed the custom publication object to basically go away.

- Added documentation in the form of a doctest.

  zope.security.getProxiedObject. Use zope.security.removeSecurityProxy

  zope.security.getProxiedObject. Use zope.security.removeSecurityProxy
  instead.  (This should also be used rather than removeAllProxies.)


Also converted additional removeAllProxies calls to the prefered
removeSecurityProxy. (These were on the trunk, but not the branch.)

Dang, I checked in a pdb call.

That's what I get for skimping on running the tests. "But I only
deleted a comment!". Sheesh.
Removed a missleading comment.

Moved forbidden and unauthorized exception definitions to
zope.security.interfaces.

Rearranged the security apis, largely combining security policies and
interactions. Now security policies are just interaction factories --
usually just the interaction class.  

See:

  http://mail.zope.org/pipermail/zope3-dev/2004-July/011656.html
Replaced zope.deprecation dependency with BBB imports
post release
release
Use zope.deprecation instead of zope.deferredimport

Look up the application controller through a utility registration
rather than a direct reference.
Put back 2 deprecated exception types
Changed my mind: put the <browser:defaultView> handler back in zope.app.publisher, but moved the defaultview API to zope.publisher.

Moved the <browser:defaultView> directive handler to
zope.app.publication, since zope.app.publication is what
uses the registration.

Moved the DefaultViewName API from zope.app.publisher to
zope.app.publication, removing the dependency on
zope.app.publisher except for testing purposes.

Moved IHTTPException to zope.publisher, removing the dependency
on zope.app.http.
metadata update
PublicationTraverser moved to zope.traversing
registration moved from zope.app.publisher
Declare already-existing dependencies

Two error handling corrections:

1. If we can't get the path of an object in order to annotate the 
transaction, we have to swallow the TypeError and not record any path.  
However, a better solution would be for the path discovery code to 
raise something more meaningful than TypeError.

2. When rendering an exception view, call mapply() directly to 
avoid passing positional arguments.  Otherwise, the system breaks 
when trying to report errors that occur in XML-RPC methods that
accept arguments.

In handleException, it's ok if there's no user for the request.

Otherwise Zope can't report that there is no default user (it breaks 
in handleException)

Fix include package and file.
zope.app.securitypolicy was deprecated except a browser package.
Fix indent.
Added missing zope.app.publisher dependency

Use zope:adpater ZCML directive instead of zope:view.
This avoid dependency on zope.app.component

Added SessionLayer, SQLScriptLayer, OnlineHelpLayer,
PublicationLayer and AppWorkflowLayer.
Set svn:keywords=Id for *.py files.
Set svn:eol-style=native for *.py files.
Update imports after zope.app.security refactorings
Bump version.
Adapt to the recent removal of bbb interfaces.
fix typo
Use builtin set instead of deprecated in python2.6 sets.Set.
Nail down only ZODB for tests.
Remove deprecated stuff. Fix package's homepage and mailing list address.
Import ISite from zope.location.interfaces instead of zope.app.component.interfaces.
nail down enough versions for the tests to pass

- remove unused imports
- avoid deprecation warning
fix recurring typo: occured --> occurred
fix just-slightly-too-long line
remove spurious executable bit

remove many calls to removeAllProxies(), and replace others with
removeSecurityProxy()

(merged from ZopeX3-3.0 branch revision 27267)

use removeSecurityProxy() instead of removeAllProxies() in many places

(merged from ZopeX3-3.0 branch revision 27260)
Substitute zope.app.zapi by direct calls to its wrapped apis. See bug 219302
added find-links to zope.org

- zope.pagetemplate.pagetemplatefile introspects the html http-equiv
  header to guess the content encoding. This did not work for XHTML
  content.

- zope.app.publisher.browser.pagetemplateresource sets the Content-Type
  header like the other page templates do it.


This basically fixes page templates in resource directories having a byte order
mark. Those were delivered as text/plain.
make schema.xml locally available in server implementation, so they can be installed as eggs, ZConfig does not provide the ability to reference schema files via package paths
finished buildout
merge ftests into tests
more deps, not ready
tests work but we have to track deps on other projects
structure added

Ensure Retry exceptions are propogated to the publisher by
zopepublication.handleException
port XXX fixes from 3.2 branch (revisions 40833 and 40829)
help Andreas on his quest to make this particular bit of code cleaner :)

the new code for getting the publication would return a new publication each
time, the old code would reuse them; that behavior has been re-instated by
using a publication cache; added tests to make sure the behavior is preserved

fix duplication of code that resulted in new request utility lookup not
happening during tests
making getFactoriesFor() fault-safe against white-space issues

requests containing a content-type header like 'text/xml; charset=utf-8'
caused a wrong publisher choice since publishers are registered per-mimetype
and not per-mimetype+charset
replaced nested if-clauses with cleaner code
typo
typos
moved import out of method definition
fixed startup problem
fixed tests
svn:keywords

- some fixes
- pdb removal
- removed unnecessary imports
fixes and more tests
fixes
some more comments and tweaks
minor changes
replace chooseClasses() implementation with the new RequestPublicationRegistry
some more comments
added configuration for the PublicationRegistry
required functionality is working, code needs more comments and polishing
more tests, some renaming
first bleeding-edge implementation
some renaming
typo
re-adding the good stuff from the former prototype
Fixed a typo.
remove appearances of ztapi.handle

Implemented HTTP 405 Method Not Allowed handling in HTTPPublication.

This does not work for DELETE and PUT methods, which have views registered for
"*" and try to adapt context to IWriteFile.

issue_comments.body: Can you copy back the `.travis.yml` file from the trunk and re-push?

review_comments.body:
How is this function related to the PR?  Is this from a stray commit?

It would seem better to introduce the hook in a commit which motivated it somehow (i.e., by defining a subclass of `ZopePublication` which overrides it, or at least by documenting how it would be used).
